intro: Stylidium desertorum, commonly known as the desert stickseed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its small, glandular, and often hairy leaves. The plant produces tiny, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is adapted to survive in dry conditions with a deep root system and reduced leaf surface. Stylidium desertorum is often found in sandy soils and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
